abstract: Window collection behaviors related to Mission Control, Spaces, and Stage Manager.
overview:

Collection behaviors are properties you set on windows to control their display characteristics in window management technologies. Use them to specify a preference on how windows behave in window management technologies like Mission Control, Spaces, and Stage Manager.

To set a collection behavior on a window, assign one or more behavior options to the window’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/collectionBehavior-swift.property] property:

Not all collection behaviors apply to all windowing management technologies, and some are mutually exclusive to their respective groups. For example, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/CollectionBehavior-swift.struct/primary], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/CollectionBehavior-swift.struct/auxiliary], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/CollectionBehavior-swift.struct/canJoinAllApplications] only apply to full screen and Stage Manager. They’re also mutually exclusive. Specify at most one per window.

# NSWindow.CollectionBehavior

**Structure**

Window collection behaviors related to Mission Control, Spaces, and Stage Manager.

## Declaration

```swift
struct CollectionBehavior
```

## Overview

Collection behaviors are properties you set on windows to control their display characteristics in window management technologies. Use them to specify a preference on how windows behave in window management technologies like Mission Control, Spaces, and Stage Manager.

To set a collection behavior on a window, assign one or more behavior options to the window’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/collectionBehavior-swift.property] property:



Not all collection behaviors apply to all windowing management technologies, and some are mutually exclusive to their respective groups. For example, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/CollectionBehavior-swift.struct/primary], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/CollectionBehavior-swift.struct/auxiliary], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/CollectionBehavior-swift.struct/canJoinAllApplications] only apply to full screen and Stage Manager. They’re also mutually exclusive. Specify at most one per window.

## Window Collection Behaviors Creation

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a window collection behavior using the given raw value.

## Stage Manager and full screen

- **primary**: The behavior marking this window as primary for both Stage Manager and full screen.
- **auxiliary**: The behavior marking this window as auxiliary for both Stage Manager and full screen.
- **canJoinAllApplications**: The behavior marking this window as one that can join all apps for both Stage Manager and full screen.

## Spaces

- **canJoinAllSpaces**: The window can appear in all spaces.
- **moveToActiveSpace**: When the window becomes active, move it to the active space instead of switching spaces.

## Mission Control

- **stationary**: Mission Control doesn’t affect the window, so it stays visible and stationary, like the desktop window.

## Spaces and Mission Control

- **managed**: The window participates in Mission Control and Spaces.
- **transient**: The window floats in Spaces and hides in Mission Control.

## Full screen

- **fullScreenPrimary**: The window can enter full-screen mode.
- **fullScreenAuxiliary**: The window displays on the same space as the full screen window.
- **fullScreenNone**: The window doesn’t support full-screen mode.
- **fullScreenAllowsTiling**: The window can be a secondary full screen tile even if it can’t be a full screen window itself.
- **fullScreenDisallowsTiling**: The window doesn’t support being a full-screen tile window, but may support being a full-screen window.

## Window cycling

- **participatesInCycle**: The window participates in the window cycle for use with the Cycle Through Windows menu item.
- **ignoresCycle**: The window isn’t part of the window cycle for use with the Cycle Through Windows menu item.

## Constants

- **NSWindow.SelectionDirection**: Constants that specify the direction a window is currently using to change the key view.
- **NSWindow.ButtonType**: Constants that provide a way to access standard title bar buttons.
- **NSRunLoop—Ordering Modes for NSWindow**: Constants that specify the priority for runloop messages.
- **NSWindow.Depth**: A type that represents the depth, or amount of memory, for a single pixel in a window or screen.
- **NSWindow.BackingStoreType**: Constants that specify how the window device buffers the drawing done in a window.
- **NSWindow.OrderingMode**: Constants that let you specify how a window is ordered relative to another window.
- **NSWindow.SharingType**: Constants that represent the access levels other processes can have to a window’s content.
- **NSWindow.NumberListOptions**: Options to use when retrieving window numbers from the system.
- **NSWindow.AnimationBehavior**: Constants that control the automatic window animation behavior windows use when ordering to the front or out of view.
- **NSWindow.OcclusionState**: Specifies whether the window is occluded.
- **NSWindow.TitleVisibility**: Specifies the appearance of the window’s title bar area.
- **NSWindow.UserTabbingPreference**: A value that indicates the user’s preference for window tabbing.
- **NSWindow.TabbingMode**: The preferred tabbing behavior of a window.
- **Application Kit Version for Deferred Window Display Support**: The version of the AppKit.framework containing a specific bug fix or capability.
- **Application Kit Version for Custom Sheet Position**: The version of the AppKit.framework containing a specific bug fix or capability.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- OptionSet
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- SetAlgebra
